review:
this games maps and characters and literally everything was balanced around 6v6 and instead of balancing the 6v6 they changed it to a 5v5 removing one of the tank roles on both teams throwing the entire gameplay askew making the only impactful role damage.

On top of this they removed every feature they possibly could so that the only way you would feel any reward from playing the game would be through the battlepass and leveling it up.

In this newest update and the launch on steam they've added back a bit of the polish they lost going from overwatch 1 to 2, adding some progression features back, while this is a step in the right direction one of the biggest aspects of what people loved from overwatch 1 which was collecting skins is still missing from overwatch 2.  

but it is too little too late to try and paint over what we saw on the release of overwatch 2 which was a glimpse into what the company has become and how little the people running this thing cared about the players and how much they cared about turning it into a money making live service microtransaction machine

it's morally dubious to even play the game at this point but even with how they've skewed the gameplay it's still fun, so play it but don't spend a single cent on it cause the company does not respect you and has slapped their players in the face many times now and will most likely do it again if they think it will earn them some quick money
Me gusta el juego pero igual quiero contribuir a las rese√±as negativas, de nada bliizzard.

I suffer as Ramattra has suffered! My torment will outlast the stars! When the universe dwindles into dust, there I sill be, still suffering, as Ramattra has.. suffered.

[h1] Pros [/h1]
Ana and Reinhardt <3

[h1] Cons [/h1]
Everything else

At this point bring back 6v6, but let the sixth hero be an emotional support Reinhardt, god knows we need one.

Best part of the game is when Kiriko lets the kitsune guide you to the shop where you can buy $20 skins, and the money is used to make sure tank players will never have fun.

The new support is pretty cool too.
NO compren el "modo historia" lo pondr√°n en gamepass este a√±o en cualquier momento

Why gatekeep your half-arsed missions behind a ¬£12.99 paywall and force me to grind to play the new hero every couple seasons? Also why on earth has it took me 80 hours (on battlenet) to unlock ONE LEGENDARY SKIN for free? By this time in OW1 I would've easily been able to get enough credits to buy multiple skins and have tried my luck in the FREE lootboxes to (hopefully) get a random one.

Despite this, the gameplay is alright, If you liked OW1, you'll like OW2. Still can't give that postive review because OW1 was just superior and the game is a far cry from what it once was.

Je peux dire plusieurs choses sur ce jeux : 
-La sortie OW2 sur Steam : sa ce voit que Blizzard ne savent plus quoi foutre et on besoin de thune
-Faire payer un mode de jeux que tout les joueurs de OW1 attendent 
-Les gens qui disent qu'il existe un seul jeux dans ce genre en mentionnant OW2... voyont... vous connaissez pas Team Fortress 2 jeunes gens et TF2 a largement plus de lore qu'OW
-Je tient a dire que les seuls bon h√©ros ajout√© dans OW2 sont Kriko et Ramattra
-Avant sur OW1 la plupart des skins √©taient gratuits gr√¢ce au lootboxes... mtn il faut payer plus de 10 Euros pour avoir UN SEUL SKIN LEGENDAIRE

pour mettre une avis positif sur OW2, je tient a dire que soit vous avez jou√© a OW1 et a Team Fortress 2 ou que c le seul FPS auquel vous avez jouez dans votre vie

one of the best games ever made

I was born on a Steam Street where the loyal drums did beat
And those loving Blizzard feet, they walked all over us
And every single night when Asmon would come home tight
He'd invite the neighbours out with this chorus:

Come out ye battle.fags
Come out and fight me like a man
Show your CEO how you won milk down in the office
Tell him how the playerbase
Made you run like hell away
From the blue and lovely lanes of Mostly Positive

Come let us hear you tell
How you slandered great Blitzchung 
When you thought him well and truly persecuted
Where are the sneers and jeers
That you loudly let us hear?
When Heroes of the Storm was executed

Come out ye battle.fags
Come out and fight me like a man
Show your CEO how you won milk down in the office
Tell him how the playerbase
Made you run like hell away
From the blue and lovely lanes of Mostly Positive 

Come tell us how you slew
That ol' PVE too
Like Reforged it came out rather shallow
How bravely you cut all
With your trillion dollar banks
And you frightened them damn investors to their marrow

Come out ye battle.fags
Come out and fight me like a man
Show your CEO how you won milk down in the office
Tell him how the playerbase
Made you run like hell away
From the blue and lovely lanes of Mostly Positive 

The time is coming fast
And I think this day near
When that rotten Kotick will run before us
And if there'll be a need
Then our kids will say "GG no team"
With a verse or two of singing this fine chorus:

Come out ye battle.fags
Come out and fight me like a man
Show your CEO how you won milk down in the office
Tell him how the playerbase
Made you run like hell away
From the blue and lovely lanes of Mostly Positive

do you enjoy having promises broken? having portions of a game hyped up for years and then cancelled? do you like having heroes in a moba-centric game paywalled in general -or- paywalled through season passes? do you like being constantly strung around by a handful of corporate morons who have lost (read: dont give a single crap about) all direction other than money? do you like work/content done by what is probably a whipped and lashed team of developers who have probably been yelled at to march for the money or perish?

then, yeah! Overwatch 2. enjoy, i guess. or play something else that will respect your time, wallet, and appreciation.

text chat

as someone who preordered this game back in 2016, i wouldn't recommend you to play this, even for free.

I have over 600 hours in this game as of writing.
While I am definitely disappointed with the PvE and the cancellation and all that stuff, I still think it is an enjoyable PvP shooter.
If you like a good PvP shooter, with a ton of unique characters, with their own abilities and stories, as well as cool (though expensive) skins and some stupid fun chaotic gamemodes, as well as some relaxing although a bit boring PvE side-missions, this game is for you.

I can understand the negative reviews and I was devastated when they said PvE was mostly cancelled, since I love skill trees, but that doesn't change that the PvP is still really fun when not playing against Hanzo or Widow.

The writing was on the wall when Jeff Kaplan Left Blizzard!

Overwatch 1 Died So Overwatch 2 could exist...

The promise of Overwatch 2 was we were going to get a Story driven PVE Campaign something Activision Blizzard cancelled...

The only way Overwatch as a franchise can be saved is by Microsoft the new overlords reverse the decision and actually release Overwatch 2 as it was originally intended.

I loved this game one of my favourites of last generation...it's a damn shame the game/franchise has become almost unrelevent due to mismanagement and bad decisions.

I installed the Steam version because I have no reason to continue to use Battlenet for one game so its nice to see Overwatch finally arrive on Steam...

I hope for the best for this franchise but unfortunately I have to judge it by what the game is as of mid 2023 and my god its awful!

Hero's locked behind expensive paywalls tedious grindy battle passes with 90% filler like charms and sprays,

Please bring back Overwatch 1 or Overwatch 2 that we were promised and I'll update my review.
Bobby Kotick needs a new boat so he killed Overwatch 1 and Overwatch 2 PvE. and made it into a mobile money hungry game.

The PVE "content" is a scam.
Blizzard expects players to pay 15 dollars for roughly 2 hours of at best mediocre and most of the time tedious and repetitive gameplay with no replay value whatsoever.
